EventTitle: First cases of pneumonia reported in Wuhan, China
Description: Chinese authorities report cases of pneumonia with unknown cause to the World Health Organization (WHO).

EventTitle: WHO declares a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC)
Description: WHO declares the outbreak a PHEIC, prompting global health measures and coordination.
The novel coronavirus is officially named COVID-19, signaling a global awareness of the virus.
WHO characterizes COVID-19 as a pandemic, leading to worldwide panic and increased restrictions.
The U.S. declares a national emergency, prompting widespread public and economic response.

EventTitle: Introduction of social distancing guidelines in the U.S.
Description: U.S. government introduces social distancing guidelines, encouraging lockdowns and closures.
The UK government announces a lockdown to curb the spread of COVID-19.
COVID-19 cases worldwide surpass 1 million, marking a significant milestone.

EventTitle: George Floyd's death and global protests
Description: The death of George Floyd in the U.S. sparks global protests, intersecting with pandemic issues.

EventTitle: COVID-19 case spikes in multiple countries
Description: Several countries, including the U.S. and Brazil, experience major spikes in cases.

EventTitle: WHO acknowledges potential for airborne transmission
Description: WHO updates guidance to reflect the possibility of airborne transmission in crowded places.

EventTitle: Pfizer announces successful COVID-19 vaccine trial
Description: Pfizer announces its vaccine is over 90% effective, sparking hope and discussions about vaccines.

EventTitle: First COVID-19 vaccine (Pfizer-BioNTech) authorized for emergency use in the U.S.
Description: The U.S. FDA grants Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) for the Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine.
The U.S. Capitol is stormed, heavily impacting public discourse amidst the pandemic.

EventTitle: Joe Biden inaugurated as U.S. President
Description: Joe Biden takes office, introducing new pandemic strategies and relief efforts.

EventTitle: One-year anniversary of COVID-19 pandemic declaration
Description: Reflection on one year since the pandemic declaration, sparking discussions on Reddit.

EventTitle: Pause on Johnson & Johnson vaccine in the U.S.
Description: The U.S. pauses the J&J vaccine due to rare blood clot cases, causing debate and concern.

EventTitle: UK lifts most COVID-19 restrictions (Freedom Day)
Description: The UK removes most legal restrictions despite rising cases, leading to mixed reactions.
The Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine receives full FDA approval, influencing vaccine mandates and opinions.
